programme.title: Dr. Oakley, Yukon Vet
programme.desc: Making house calls in the far reaches of Northern Canada is a daunting task in the least, considering the houses may be separated by hundreds of miles. That challenge doesn't stop Dr. Michelle Oakley from performing her many duties as a veterinarian in one of the most rugged environments on Earth. In addition to running an animal clinic out of her home in Haines Junction, Yukon -- where she lives with husband Shane and their three daughters -- Dr. Oakley also operates a satellite clinic 150 miles away and is the on-call vet for the Yukon Wildlife Preserve, which is about 100 miles from Haines Junction. She also makes house calls, sometimes driving for long stretches through desolate wilderness to check on a patient. This series documents how Dr. Oakley juggles being a full-time vet, wife and mom, and does so with a sense of humor and devotion.

To reveal what's happening within the volcano, visit the 'new' Island of Surtsey, flamingos flocking in Kenya, and a boiling geyser in Iceland. Witness the daring attempt to lower a data gathering probe right into the crater of a volcano just before it erupts.

programme.title: North America with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon begins his most ambitious journey yet; travelling the entire length of the Americas. In this first leg, Simon travels from Alaska, down through Canada to Vancouver.

programme.title: The World's Deadliest Weather
programme.desc: Hurricane Harvey, the most powerful hurricane in a decade to strike the United States, rips a coastal town apart and dumps a once-in-a-thousand-year rainfall that drowns the city of Houston.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Cherry Healey is in South Africa visiting one of the largest iron ore mines in the world. Gregg Wallace is in France at a foundry that produces a cast iron pot every five seconds. And historian Ruth Goodman takes a journey through time.

programme.title: Extreme Treks

programme.desc: Gordon makes fantastic vegetarian recipes, including halloumi, courgette and herb cakes, and white chocolate and lime mousse.

programme.desc: The first four contenders face their opening Skills Test. Two must get all the details just right as they prepare bangers and mash in only 20 minutes. The others cook monkfish.

programme.desc: Heat one continues as each chef cooks two standout Signature Dishes; a main and a dessert that demonstrate creative flair and individual cooking style.

programme.desc: The signature round features a miniature cheesecake, while the technical challenge features a dish that dates back to the 17th century. Finally, for their showstoppers, the bakers must concoct a jelly art dessert cake constructed of delicate sponge.

programme.desc: In the second heat, the Skills Tests involve scallops and a crème pâtissière swiss roll. Then the chefs try to impress the judges with two Signature Dishes that demonstrate their culinary identities.

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay searches for the UK's most exciting new food and drink business, putting 12 entrepreneurs through a series of challenges as they compete to win his £150,000 investment.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The signature round features plenty of alcohol, while the technical challenge sets the bakers the task of making pastry horns. Finally, for the Showstopper, they must use all the precision they can muster to construct a cake made entirely from smaller cak.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: In the second heat, the Skills Tests involve scallops and a crème pâtissière swiss roll. Then the chefs try to impress the judges with two Signature Dishes that demonstrate their culinary identities.

programme.title: Guardians Of The Wild
programme.desc: Explore the largest, wildest protected area of Zambia, where a team of biologists and vets races against the oncoming rainy season to save and protect Africa's endangered top predators, including cheetahs, wild dogs, and lions.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running With The Pack
programme.desc: Film a wild dog hunt with Julz as he catches up with the Manzi pack at a kill, and watch for leopards and hyenas as the Kakuli pack takes great risks while waiting for the rains to come. Go on an epic hunt with a returning male of the Stork Colony.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running With The Pack
programme.desc: Welcome the rains as an emotional Julz says farewell to the dog packs. He discovers the Stork Colony pups hunting guinea fowl, and is heartened to find the Kakuli pups feeding on an antelope carcass. The playful Manzi pack corner a tough warthog.

programme.title: Guardians Of The Wild
programme.desc: A ray of hope appeared for Zambia's extinct black rhinos when a small population were translocated from South Africa. See a fearless team track and dart the huge creatures to replace radio tags, then scramble out of the way before the rhinos wake up.

programme.title: Turtle Beach
programme.desc: Locals call it the 'arribada', or 'arrival'. The magical days and nights when tens of thousands of sea turtles come ashore in Costa Rica, to lay millions of eggs. In Turtle Beach, new discoveries abound, as Canadian naturalist and cameraman Hugo Kitching follows a team of international scientists on a groundbreaking expedition to uncover the mysteries of this rare phenomenon.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Welcome spring's arrival across Africa, and discover the life-giving gifts the season offers to the continent's plant and animal life. Get a close-up look at animal families raising their young, and celebrate their emergence into the wider world.

programme.title: Strange Creatures
programme.desc: Evolution has granted some animals a distinct advantage over their opponents. Investigate the perfect body-part mutations that have given wunderpus octopuses, axolotls, royal spoonbills, aye-ayes, and other creatures an edge.

programme.desc: The seas are alive with carnivores. Meet the sharks and rays who patrol the coral reefs, hunting down their prey. Learn about toxic fish who disguise themselves to ambush the unwary, and armoured predators who devour vulnerable targets.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Tiny kingfishers, flocks of great white pelicans, endangered vultures, and countless other species of birds have all found a use for every inch of the Luangwa Valley. Watch these winged wonders search for food, shelter, and mates.

programme.title: Strange Creatures
programme.desc: Crawl along with some of the world's fiercest insects. Watch as giant cockroaches build their immune systems to ensure long life. Then check out the toxic prowess of giant millipedes and the invisibility cloaks of giant prickly stick insects.

programme.title: Strange Creatures
programme.desc: Hiding in plain sight helps many insect, fish, and amphibian species survive. Learn the ins and outs of an array of animal invisibility techniques, such as warning and disruptive colouration, mimicry, and active camouflage.

programme.title: Attack and Defend
programme.desc: With strategies ranging from fearsome size and speed to sophisticated teamwork and bone-crushing strength, the world's most highly adapted predators have evolved formidable means of surviving and thriving in the harsh African savannahs.

programme.title: Untamed Valley
programme.desc: Dive into Kasikizi Lagoon, where hippos go to escape the hustle and bustle of the river bends. Meet other residents of this wild sanctuary, from water scorpions to fish eagles to marabou storks hoping to steal a quick meal before the oasis dries up.

programme.title: Untamed Valley
programme.desc: Battle the beachmaster, a giant hippo who rules a two-mile-long section of the river's biggest bend. Watch his fellow creatures evade the Nsefu pride of lions, who are looking for an easy meal, unless a Nile crocodile decides to steal their dinner.

programme.title: Untamed Valley
programme.desc: Leave the river behind and stalk the valley's grasslands. Explore territory that's home to a troop of baboons, a family of warthogs, and a solitary female leopard named Olimba. Check in with a nesting family of storks and fend off wild dogs at night.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Tackle an emergency when Dr. Amanda removes a sable antelope's tracking collar, and see the animal-care team help a flea-riddled baby vervet monkey find a new mom. Free two orphaned serval cats and follow 20 yellow baboons into their new enclosure.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Feel heartbreak when Dr. Amanda's team loses a pangolin abused by wildlife traffickers, but cheer when another is released post-rehab. Check on a trio of hedgehogs and tag along as the centre's baboons and nyala antelopes get a change of scenery.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Strap in for Dr. Amanda's risky attempt to collar a wild roan antelope. Later, chase down blue monkey Indigo while unrest ensues among the vervets. Examine an eagle owl with bumblefoot and say adieu to Sheila the croc, who's headed back to the wild.

programme.title: Becoming Orangutan
programme.desc: Welcome baby orangutan Topan, an orphan in need of a surrogate mom. Watch her learning journey in nursery school while her fellow students move through junior, senior, and wild-immersion schools. Meanwhile, 16-year-old Kasper preps for graduation.

programme.title: Becoming Orangutan
programme.desc: Observe blossoming friendships and interspecies bonds in nursery school, and peek inside a bromance among junior-school buds Valentino, Yutris, and Madara. See distractible Beni lean into his love of food and get a beating from a more-senior pupil.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: The 40-strong King troop has the run of the Sri Lankan temple ruins they call home, but Ana, whose new baby is due any day, is at the bottom of the pecking order. Follow her struggle to find food during the most difficult dry season in years.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: A teenage toque macaque has led an idyllic life in the ancient Sri Lankan temples his troop calls home. But as adulthood approaches, he'll soon have to leave the safety of the ruins and find a new troop. Join his journey into a daunting new world.

programme.title: Strange Creatures

programme.title: Ocean Parks
programme.desc: In the Florida Keys, mangrove swamps serve as nurseries for fish and hunting grounds for endangered waterfowl, seagrass serves as food and shelter for fish and crustaceans, and coral reefs host diverse fish species and endangered sea turtles.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons
programme.desc: Journey deep into the heart of a wild kingdom made of riverine forests and endless savanna. Here, a number of diverse keystone species are shaping the vibrant ecosystem, from dominant elephant herds to tiny dung beetles.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: Tensions rise when drought overtakes an ancient Sri Lankan temple shared by tufted grey langurs, toque macaques, and purple-faced leaf monkeys. Witness the drama as the lower-ranking primates struggle to stay hydrated amid a mutinous plot.

programme.title: Land of Gremlins
programme.desc: Follow a family of indris, some of the world's largest lemurs, on their daily quest through the rainforest to find food and escape predators. See how these endangered primates survive against all odds in a rapidly shrinking habitat.

programme.title: Land of Gremlins
programme.desc: Tour Madagascar's tall mountain ranges, lush rainforests, treed coastal plains, and parched deserts. See how Jurassic-era plants, ancient frog and reptile species, and new castaways have evolved in these strange, beautiful landscapes.

programme.title: Attack and Defend
programme.desc: Keen eyesight, razor-sharp talons, and other adaptations help raptors like the peregrine falcon, red-tailed hawk, and bald eagle hunt from above. Fly alongside these magnificent raptors to see the world from the remarkable eyes of an aerial predator.

programme.title: Attack and Defend
programme.desc: Insects offer a virtually unlimited food source for the cunning predators that have evolved ways to hunt them. Discover the highly developed skills of dragonflies, scorpions, Venus flytraps, and praying mantises.

programme.title: Australia's Hidden Islands
programme.desc: The crown jewel of the Great Barrier Reef, Lady Elliot Island is a mecca for underwater life, teeming with colourful coral, manta rays, sea turtles, and humpback whales to form a dizzying array of biodiversity unrivalled anywhere on the reef.

programme.title: Australia's Hidden Islands
programme.desc: Cast adrift and alone in the nutrient-rich Southern Ocean, cut off by wild seas and brutal winds, lies an enchanted island fortress where some of Australia's most iconic mainland fauna have made a last stand.

programme.title: Australia's Hidden Islands
programme.desc: A speck of an island in the Indian Ocean is a tiny refuge to plants and creatures found nowhere else in the world. Birds rule its skies, whale sharks patrol its seas, and an endemic land crab undertakes a treacherous migration to breed.

programme.title: Australia's Hidden Islands
programme.desc: Built on shifting sands that support an unlikely haven for plants and wildlife, this perpetually evolving island mosaic of curious habitats has earned World Heritage Status for its remarkable geological history.

programme.title: Kingdom Of The Tide
programme.desc: Low tide exposes a band of shore called the intertidal zone. It's a place of stunning extremes, attacked by hurricane force waves and exposed to baking heat. Creatures here have evolved in countless bizarre ways. Scientists explore this alien realm.

programme.title: The Ocean's Greatest Feast
programme.desc: Get a front-row seat to the planet's biggest biomass migration, the annual 1,000-mile sardine run along South Africa's east coast. See billions of these tiny fish run a gauntlet of hungry predators, including stealthy seals and dive-bombing gannets.

programme.title: Alien Abyss
programme.desc: Get acquainted with an array of ocean oddballs and learn how billions of years' worth of changes, from ice ages to asteroid strikes, have shaped their looks and skills. Meet blind worms who fish, walking sharks, tree-climbing crabs, and much more.

programme.title: Alien Abyss
programme.desc: Feel the love in the strange-but-heartwarming partnerships between some of Earth's oddest creatures. Dive deep to see strange animals, from snapping shrimp to wolf eels, offer a hand to their fellow ocean-going weirdos to ensure mutual survival.

programme.title: Alien Abyss
programme.desc: Channel your inner sci-fi fan and explore the bizarre mating rituals of the ocean's most peculiar creatures. Learn how bloody battles for mates, gender bending, and supersize litters of babies just might secure a next generation for these animals.

programme.title: Weird, Wild & Wonderful
programme.desc: Trek across Africa for a peek at the colourful, quirky survival strategies of its animals. See these furry, feathered, and scaled magicians, from flamboyant flamingos to vanishing lizards, find food, elude predators, and find mates against all odds.

programme.title: Attack and Defend
